que  Brectulach  nominatur  Deo  et  Sancto  Tarranano  et  episcopatui  d# 
Brechin  •  Tenendum  et  habendum  in  puram  et  perpetuam  elimosinam

Carta  Roberti  Broyss  super  Immunitate  terrarum   et  possessionum  epis- 
copi  et  capituli  Brechinensis  ab  omni  servitio  et  exactione  seculari  • 

II-  XVobertus  Dei  gratia  Rex  Scotorum  •  Justiciariis  Vicecomitibus  Burgo- 
rum  prepositis  et  eorum  balliuis  Ceterisque  ministris  et  fidelibus  nostris  ad 
quos  presentes  litere  nostre  peruenerint  •  Salutem  •  Nolentes  sicuti  nec 
debemus  quod  terre  ecclesie  Brechinensis  que  Episcopo  Decano  Canoni- 
cis  aut  Capellanis  eiusdem  ecclesie  comrauniter  aut  diuisim  in  puram 
et  perpetuam  elimosinam  sunt  collate  a  diuersis  fundatoribus  et  infeoda- 
toribus  suis  quibuscunque  qui  seruicium  nostrum  facere  tenentur  pro 
eisdem  ad  predictum  seruicium  nostrum  per  quoscunque  balliuos  seu 
ministros  de  cetero  compellantur  ■  Vobis  precipiendo  mandamus  quatenus 
quotienscunque  seruicium  nostrum  de  terris  suis  predictis  debitum 
exigere  vos  contigerit  ipsum  seruicium  a  fundatoribus  et  infeodatoribus 
suis  qui  ad  illud  seruicium  tenentur  totaliter  exigatis  et  eorum  feoda 
capitalia  si  necesse  fuerit  pro  dicto  seruicio  debite  distringatis,  ita 
quod  terre  dictorum  Episcopi  Decani  Canonicorum  et  Capellanorum  et 
eorum  possessiones  ab  huiusmodi  oneribus  et  exactionibus  libere  sint 
penitus  atque  quitte  •  Firmiterque  prohibemus  ne  quis  ipsos  Episcopum 
Decanum  Canonicos  aut  Capellanos  seu  eorum  aliquem  homines  suos  seu 
eorum  bona  vel  possessiones  contra  presentium  nostrarum  literarum 
tenorem  aliqualiter  grauare  seu  vexare  presumat  super  nostram  plena- 
riam  forisfacturam  •  Et  si  quid  ab  eis  in  premissis  exactum  vel  eis 
iniuriatum  fuerit,  id  sibi  restitui  corrigi  et  reformari  faciatis  quotiens- 
cunque  et  quandocunque  rationabiliter  per  ipsos  vel  ipsorum  aliquem 
fueritis  requisiti  •  In  cuius  rei  testimonium  has  literas  nostras  vobis 
ostendendas  et  penes  ipsam  ecclesiam  perpetuo  remansuras  sibi  fieri 
fecimus  patentes  •  Apud  Brechin  quarto  die  Decembris  Anno  regni 
nostri  Quarto  •

douchheych  quamquidem  terram  cum  dominiis  et  communia  predictis

nauit  ac  totum  ius  et  clameum  quod  habuit  in  eisdem  vel  habere  potuerit 
pro  se  et  heredibus  suis  omnino  quietum  clamauit  imperpetuum  •  Te- 
nendam  et  habendam  predicto  Willelmo  et  heredibus  suis  de  nobis  et

sedit  per  seruicium  iude  debitum  et  consuetum  •  In  cuius  rei  testimonium

Carta  regis  Dauid  de  libero  introitu  et  exitu  infra  aquas  de  Tay  et 
Suthesk  • 

VI.  Dauid  Dei  gratia  rex  Scottorum  •  Omnibus  probis  hominibus  tocius 
"  terre  sue  •  Salutem  •  Sciatis  nos  dedisse  concessisse  et  hac  presenti 
carta  nostra  confirmasse  venerabili  in  Christo  patri  Patricio  Episcopo 
Brechinensi  •  Quod  omnes  mercatores,  villam  de  Brechyn  pro  terapore 
inh[ab]itantes,  de  cetero  liberura  introitum  habeant  et  exitum  infra 
aquas  de  Tay,  et  de  Suth  Esk,  infra  vicecomitatum  de  Forfar,  cura  suis 
mercandiis,  et  bonis,  quotiens  et  quando  voluerint,  in  batellis,  nauibus, 
et  farcostis  •  Soluendo  nobis,  et  aliis  quorum  interest,  custumas  tara 
maiores  quam  minores  debitas  et  consuetas  •  Non  obstante  aliqua  as- 
sedatione  per  noa  vel  per  Camerarium  nostrura  burgensibus  de  Dunde,

et  de  Monros,  de  eorum  burgis,  hucusque  facta,  vel  in  posterum  faci-

sibus  et  fratribus  gildarum  dictorum  burgorum  de  Dunde  et  de  Monros,

Lethnoth  creasse  prebendam  perpetuis   futuris   temporibus    duraturam 
sub  certis  forma  et  modo  inferius  annotatis  viz.  quod  quicunque  pro  tem- 
pore  fuerit  rector  dicte  ecclesie  de  Lethnoth  semper  sit  Canonicus  in 
dicta  ecclesia  nostra  Brechinensi  et  quod  stallum  habeat  in  choro  et 
locum  in  capitulo,  et  de  opanibus  aliis  que  ad  jus  canonicatus  pertinent 
eidem   respondeatur  in   omnibus  sicut   uni   alteri    canonicorum    nostre 
ecclesie  supradicte  •  Qui  quidem  canonicus  in  pi'ebendam  suam  omnes 
fructus  redditus  prouentus  et  obuenciones  dicte   ecclesie  de  Lethnoth 
tam  maiores  quam  minores  habebit  •   Et  inueniet  annuatim  in   choro 
dicte  nostre  ecclesie  unum  subdiaconum  sufRcientera  stallarium  in  habi- 
tu  consimili  cura  stallariis  aliorum  canonicorum  celebraturum  et  minis- 
traturum  tam  in  officio  subdiaconi  et  cantoris  quara  in  aliis  officiis  infra 
dictum  chorum  hactenus  usitatis  •  Habebit  eciam  unum  Vicariura  per- 
petuum    in    dicta   ecclesia   parrochiali    de    Lethnoth    qui   viginti   duas 
marchas  de  redditibus  dicte  ecclesie  de  Lethnoth  percipiet  annuatim  ad 
terminos  Penthecostes  et  Sancti  Martini  in  hyeme,  per  porciones  equales 
si  pro  tanta  haberi  poterit  •  Cui  autera  fiet  augmentatio  non  perpetua 
set  temporalis  prout  temporis  fertilitas  seu  sterilitas  id  exposcit  •  Cui 
eciara   in  dicta  ecclesia   de  Lethnoth   residenciam  personalem   facere 
teneatur,  ac  parrochianis  tara  capelle  de  Lochlwy  quara  predicte  raatris 
ecclesie  debite  deseruire  seu  facere  deseruiri  •  Qui  eciam  vicarius  pro- 
curaciones   et   synodalia   et   omnia   onera   ordinaria   domino    Episcopo 
et   eius  Archidiacono  qui  pro   tempore  fuerit   soluere   teneatur  •  Iste 
yero  vicarius  per  canonicum  qui  pro  tempore  fuerit  domino  Episcopo 
presentabitur,  et  ex  eius  mandato  in  vicariam  instituetur  eandem  •  Et 
canonicus  semper  unus  post  alium,  cum  prebendam  de  Lethnoth  vacare 
contigerit,  per  dictura  dorainura  de  Lyndysay  et  heredes  suos  presen- 
tabitur  domino   Episcopo,   qui  faciet  eum  ut  moris  est  iu  canonicura 
recipi  et  debite  installari  •  Et  si  dictus  canonicus  negligens  fuerit  in

presentatione  vicarii  ad  curam,  vel  subdiaconi  ad  stallum  cum  vacauer- 
int,  vel  in  solucione  salarii  eorundem,  ita  quod  infra  mensem  a  tempore

defectu  solucionis  salariorum  eorundem  vel  eorum  alterius  fructus  omnes

cessorum  meorum  et  specialiter  pro  animabus  eorum  quorum  aliqua  bona 
habui  in  hac  vita  et  plenam  satisfactionem  inde  non  feci  •  et  pro  anima- 
bus  omnium  fidelium  defunctorum  dedisse  concessisse  et  hac  presenti 
carta  mea  confirmasse  Deo  et  beate  Marie  Virgini  genetrici  eiusdem  . 
ac  vni  capellano  diuina  celebranti  •  et  imperpetuum  celebraturo  in 
ecclesia  parrochiali  eiusdem  beate  Marie  de  Dunde  pro  salute  anime 
mee  ac  omnium  animarum  predictarum  duodecim  marcas  annualis  Red- 
ditus  annuatim  leuandas  de  terris  meis  de  Abirbothry  jacentibus  infra 
vicecomitatum  de  Perth  ad  duos  anni  terminos  consuetos  Pentecostes 
videlicet  et  Sancti  Martini  in  yeme  per  porciones  equales  •  Tenendas 
et  habendas  dictas  duodecim  marcas  annualis  redditus  predicto  capellano 
qui  pro  tempore  fuerit  in  liberam  puram  et  perpetuam  elimosinam  cum 
omnibus  libertatibus  commoditatibus  et  aysiamentis  ad  dictum  annuum 
redditum  spectantibus  seu  spectare  valentibus  in  futuro,  adeo  libere 
quiete  integre  honorifice  bene  et  in  pace  sicut  aliqua  elimosina  infra 
Regnum  Scocie  per  aliquem  concedi  poterit  siue  dari  •  Volo  eciam  et 
concedo  quod  quocienscunque  et  quandocunque  dictum  capellanum  qui 
pro  tempore  fuerit  decedere  seu  ex  aliqua  causa  racionabili  a  dicta 
capellania  amoueri  contigerit  .  ex  tunc  heredes  raei  qui  pro  tempore 
fuerint  infra  raensem  a  tempore  vacacionis  eiusdem  alium  capellanum 
ydoneum  domino  Episcopo  Brechinensi  vel  Decano  et  Capitulo  sede 
vacante  presentent  admittendum  pro  salute  omnium  animarum  predic- 
tarum  in  ecclesia  beate  Marie  predicta  perpetuo  celebraturo  •  cum  hoc 
eciam  adiecto  quod  dictus  capellanus  qui  pro  tempore  fuerit  quotidie 
intersit  singulis  horis  diuinis  in  dicta  ecclesia  Sancte  Marie  de  Dunde 
viz.  matutinis,  missis,  vesperis  et  aliis  horis  si  que  sint  presto  ibidem 
coadiuturus  in  diuinis  cantandis  et  legendis  cum  nota  •  Eciam  volo  et 
per  presentes  ordino,  quod  dictus  capellanus  qui  pro  tempore  fuerit  quo- 
libet  die  feriali  intersit  uni  misse  de  Requiem  ad  altare  beati  Georgii

martiris  in  predicta  ecclesia  de  Dunde,  hora  nona  diei,  una  cum  certis 
capellanis  per  me  [in]  dicta  ecclesia  fundatis  pro  salute  anime  mee,  et

suo  sibi  incumbit  dictam  missam  cum  nota  cantet  ■  Et  si  super  hiis

meis  alium  ydoneum  capellanum  presentare,  et  dictum  penitus  amouere  •

penitus  exigatur  preter  oracionum  suffragia  deuotarum  •  Et  quod  quan-

quiis,  aut  aliquibus  aliis  seruiciis  et  obseruantiis  premissis  in  nostro

XVIII.  JVJLartinus  Episcopus  Seruus  Seruorum  Dei  Ad  perpetuam  Rei  memo- 
riam  •  Ex  debito  pastoralis  officii  quo  ecclesiarum  omnium  disponente 
Domino  regimini  presidemus  ad  ea  que  ecclesiaruni  ipsarum  ac  per- 
sonarum  ecclesiasticarum  utilitates  et  commoda,  ac  diuini  cultus  aug- 
mentum  respiciunt  diligenter  intendimus  et  que  pro  hiis  prouide  facta 
sint  ut  illabata  persistant  libenter  cura  a  nobis  petitur  apostolico  rau- 
nimine  roboramus  •  Sane  pro  parte  dilectorum  filiorum,  Decani  et 
capituli  ecclesie  Brechinen.  nobis  nuper  exhibita  petitio  continebat  quod 
olim  dilectus  filius  Nobilis  Vir  Walterus  Atholie  et  Cathanie  comes

dicecesis  ad  eum  ratione  dominii  dicti  loci  legitime  pertinens  prefa-

XXII.  U  niuersis  Sancte  Matris  ecclesie  filiis  ad  quorum  notitiam  presentes 
litere  peruenerint  Salutem  in  eo  qui  est  omnium  vera  Sahis  •  Noueritis 
nos  Johannem  miseratione  diuina  Episcopum  Brechinensem  cum  consilio 
et  assensu  capituli  nostri  ad  hoc  specialiter  conuocati,  in  quo  presentes 
erant,  Magister  Gilbertus  Decauus,  Dominus  Gilbertus  Cantor,  Magis- 
ter  Gofridus  Cancellarius,  Dominus  Johannes  Lyell  Thesauraiius,  cum 
diuersis  aliis  canonicis  capellaniam  fundatam  ift  capella  Sancte  Crucis 
de  Montross  per  discretum  virum  Magistrum  Thomam  Bell  offlcialem 
nostrum  ac  vicarium  perpetuum  eiusdem  ville  de  Montross  ratificasse 
approbasse  et  confirmasse  necnon  ratificare  approbare  et  confirmare 
dictamque  fundationem  et  capellaniam  in  omnibus  suis  donationibus 
et  libertatibus  ratam  et  gratam  pro  nobis  et  successoribus  nostris 
habuisse  et  imperpetuum  habitas  et  habituras  •  Et  ut  per  capellanum 
dicte  capellanie  fundate  in  dicta  capella  Sancte    Crucis  de  Montross

dies  ab  ante  legittime  citasse  ad  comparendum  in  capitulo  predicto

dicebat  nimium  extitit  grauatus  propter  magnas  et  diuersas  reparationes

patris  sui  jacens  in  dicto  burgo  in  vico  castri  ex  parte  boreali  eiusdem 
inter  terram  Roberti  filii  Gilberti  ad  occidentem  ex  una  et  terram 
Agnetis  de  Camera  ad  orientem  partibus  ex  altera,  in  manibus  Andree 
Paniter  et  Johannis  Nudry  tunc  dicti  burgi  balliuorum  pure  et  simplici- 
ter  resignauit  cum  consensu  et  assensu  Mariote  de  Leys  matris  sue  que 
etiam  tunc  presens  fuit  et  ibidem  suum  liberum  tenementum  dicte  terre 
dicte  Agneti  filie  sue  (et)  eius  marito  sursum  reddidit  et  pro  perpetuo  re- 
signauit  preterea  renuncians  dicta  Agnes  omni  juri  quod  sibi  competere 
poterit  de  futuro,  extollensque  manus  ad  ecclesiam  beati  Petri  nunc- 
quani  se  dictum  tenementum  clamaturam  iuramentum  prestitit  corporale 
precipiens  que  balliuis  supradictis  quod  darent  sasinam  et  statum 
hereditarium  pro  perpetuo  Cuthberto  Vyly  heredibus  suis  et  assignatis 
per  terre  et  lapidis  traditionem  •  Qui  quidem  baUiui  tenementi  per  ter- 
ram  et  lapidem  sibi  prius  presentata  per  dictos  Agnetem  et  maritum 
suum  de  eorundem  mandato  ut  moris  est  in  burgo  sasinam  et  statum 
hereditarium  dicto  Cuthberto  heredibus  suis  et  assignatis  pro  perpetuo 
tradiderunt  secundum  modum  formam  conditionem  et  contractum  inter 
partes  efficaciorem,  saluo  jure  quolibet  alieno  •  Super  quibus  omnibus 
et  singulis  dictus  Cuthbertus  a  me  notario  publico  sibi  fieri  petiit  unum

dominis  Johanne  Liell  thezaurario  Brechinensi  et  magistro  Roberto  de 
Hoprew  in  loco  capitulari  ecclesie  Brechinensis  procuratoribus  .  .  .

62  CART^  ORIGINALES. 

assedaret  usque  ad  finera  processus  sui  de  eadem  uilla  et  ad  uidendum 
si  qui  aliquid  juris  ostenderent  de  pretensa  assedatione  et  precipue  si 
Patricius  de  Foulertoun  predicte  Jonete  fllius  vel  quicumque  alii  aliquid 
ostenderent  et  tunc  per  suum  prefatum  seriandum  publice  fecit  pro- 
clamari  si  aliqui  tales  essent  quod  comparerent  et  quia  nulli  tales  com- 
pararuerunt  et  duodecima  hora  longe  transacta  publice  protestatus  est 
dictus  reuerendus  pater  quod  quia  dicta  terra  in  manibus  suis  vacabat 
nec  erat  aliquis  tenens  nec  comparuit  aliquis  jus  pretendens,  Ideo  ut 
dixit  potuit  debuit  et  voluit  prouidere  et  dictam  terram  ad  honorem  et 
utilitatem  ecclesie  et  successorum  suorura  assedare,  Et  quia  audiuit 
quod  dictus  Patricius  de  Foulertoun  pretendebat  jus  assedationis  licet 
appareucia  nou  fuit  cum  pater  et  mater  eius  cognouerunt  se  nullum 
habere  nec  habuisse  jus  ut  constat  per  precedentia  tamen  ad  conuincen- 
dam  malitiara  et  futurara  rebellionem  dicti  Patricii  et  quoruracumque 
aliorura  jus  assedationis  pretendentiura  fecit  iterura  proclaraari  publice 
in  sua  curia  dictus  reuerendus  pater  qualiter  intendebat  hec  orania 
recitare  in  curia  Vicecomitis  de  Angus  tunc  tenenda  apud  Forfar  vltima 
die  Julii  proximi  •  Et  iterum  ex  superhabundantia  fecit  tunc  procla- 
mari  et  assignari  curiam  suam  tenendam  apud  Brechin  die  lune  ad 
quindecim  dies  immediate  post  super  eadem  materia  premuniendo  et 
notiflcando  dicto  Patricio  et  quibuscumque  quod  si  ipse  Patricius  vel 
quicumque  alii  pretenderent  jus  assedationis  ad  dictara  uillam  quod  tunc 
in  sua  curia  cum  jure  suo  comparerent  et  ipse  ministraret  eis  justi- 
tiara  alioquin  protestatus  est  ipsis  non  comparentibus  vel  jus  non  osten- 
dentibus  prouidere  de  dicta  uilla  et  ipsara  assedare  prout  melius  potuit  • 
Et  quia  de  assedatione  eius  prolocutum  fuit  et  aliqualiter  concordatum 
cum  nobili  viro  Alexandro  de  Craumvnde  doraino  de  Melgonde  protes- 
tatus  est  dictus  reuerendus  pater  quod  illa  prolocutio  siue  aliqualis 
concordia  non  impediret  queracuraque  ostendentera  in  dicta   proxiraa

ouria  jus  assedationis  ad  dictam  uillam,  et  hoc  idem  proprio  ore  iu

sine  tenente  protestabatur  ideo  quod  non  debebat  neque  volebat  tenere

Episcopi  Brechinensis  necnon  venerabilium  virorum  et  magistrorum  Jo- 
hannis  de  Lichtoun  decani  eiusdem,  Duncani  de  Lichtoun  decani  vi- 
carii,  Johannis  Monypeny  prebendarii  de  Buthirgill,  Laurencii  Piote 
pensionarii,  Henrici  Rynd  subdecani,  Johannis  Clat  prebendarii  de 
Glenberuy,  Ricardi  de  Guthre  prebendarii  de  Lethnot  capitulariter 
congregatorum  et  vocatorum  super  diuersis  bonum  capituli  concer- 
nentibus  ad  vicesimam  diem  Augusti  anno  Domini  millesimo  qua- 
dringentesimo  quadragesimo  octauo,  que  translatio  et  dictorum  verborum 
permutatio  facta  est  ad  requestam  venerabilis  viri  magistri  Roberti  de 
Crannach  precentoris  Brechinensis  propter  dicte  litere  papiree  et  sigilli 
communis  debilitatem  vt  coram  predictis  in  dicto  capitulo  congregatis 
per  dictum  precentorem  ostendebatur  dictam  literam  papiream  publice 
perlegendo  et  a  me  notario  publico  super  predictis  publicum  instrumen- 
tum  petendo,  predicta  omnia  et  singula  vidi  et  audivi  et  in  notam 
sumpsi  ac  prefatam  translationem  me  aliis  occupato  per  alium  scribi 
feci  rogatus  et  requisitus  in  testimonium  veritatis  omnium  premissorum 
anno  die  mense  supradictis  et  indictione  vndecima  me  manu  propria 


CART^  ORIGINALES.  73

XLVII.  el  acobus  Dei  gratia  Rex  Scotorum  •  ■  ■  Sciatis  nos  inspexisse  •  •  • 
quasdam  cartas  nonnullorum  predecessorum  nostrorum  Regum  Scotie, 
quamdam  etiam  cognitionem  factam  ex  mandato  domini  Regis  Dauid 

•  •  •  per  suum  camerarium  Walterum  Bigare  •  Necnon  aliam  cognitio- 
nem  ex  mandato  nostro  factam  per  Johannem  de  Ogilvy  de  Luntrethin 
de  libertatibus  et  priuilegiis  ecclesie  Brechinensis  •  Aliara  etiam  cogni- 
tionem  ex  mandato  nostro  factam  coram  dicto  domino  Johanne  milite 
de  Itinere  Camerarie  pro  dicto  domino  Episcopo  •  Quarumquidem  car- 
tarum  et  cognitionum  tenores  sequuntur  •  •  •  Willelmus  Rex  Scotie 

•  •  •  Sciatis  me  concessisse  et  carta  mea  confirmasse  episcopis  et  Kyl- 
deis  de  ecclesia  Brechinensi  donationem  illam  quara  dedit  eis  Rex 
Dauid  auus  meus  per  cartam  suam  de  foro  imperpetuum  habituro  in 
villa  per  dies  dominicos  Adeo  libere  sicut  Episcopus  Sanctiandree  forum 
habet  •  Test.  Andrea  Episcopo  de  Cateness  Nicholao  Cancellario  • 
Apud  Brechin  •  Alterius  vero  carte  domini  Roberti  Regis  tenor  •  ■  • 
est  talis,  Robertus  Dei  gratia  Rex  Scotorum  Vicecomiti  et  balliuis  suis 
de  Forfare  Salutem  Vobis  per  presentes  firraiter  inhibemus  ne  forum 
de  Brechin  in  cuius  libertate  et  possessione  diutina  nunc  sunt  Episco- 
pus  et  canonici  ecclesie  Brechinensis  et  sui  fuerunt  predecessores  a 
longo  prout  ex  relatione  fidedigna  concepimus  aut  aliquas  mercandias 
ibidem  exercendas  in  aliquo  grauetis  perturbetis  vel  impediatis  aliter 
quam  in  forma  communis  justitie  propter  quascumque  literas  a  nobis 
forsitan  impetratas  hucusque  vel  de  cetero  impetrandas  in  preiiulicinm 
eorundem  •  In  cuius  Rei  testimonium  has  literas  nostras  vobis  osten-

suis  prout  in  euidentiis  publicis  clare  patebit    •   Quiquidem  Johannes 
prefatis  procuratoribus  respondens  quod  suum  propositum  fiiit  siinplici- 
ter  cuni  omni  diligentia  prosequi  prefiita  terras  et  officia,  et  quod  dictum 
breue  super  eisdem  terris  et  offlciis  causauit  leuari  et  impetrari  •   Qui- 
bus  factis  et  dictis  prefati  procuratores  nomine  quo  supra  produxerunt 
quoddam    instrumentum    publicum    sub   signo   et   subscriptione   domini 
Eduardi  Roberti  •   •  •  autoritate  imperiali  notarii  publici  super  resigna- 
tione  quietaclamatione  et   renunciatione   ipsius  Johannis   super   dictis 
terris  et  officiis  recitandoque  in  eodem  instruniento  dictum  Johannem 
magnum  corporale  juramentum  prestitisse  nuncquam  in  contrarium  sue 
reuuuciationis  deuenire  •   Nichilominus  a  prosecutione  dictorum   terra- 
rum  et  offlciorum  dictus  Johannes  cessare  recusauit  sed  instantissime

tioni  demandaret  per  quod  petiit  dicta  tenas  et  offlcia  sibi  fieri  •  Quo

Civitatis  Brechinensis  capellanis  chori  ecclesie  catbedralis  . 

XCVI.  J  acobus  Dei  gratia  rex  Scotorum  omnibus  probis  hominibus  totius 
terre  sue  clericis  et  laicis  Salutem  Sciatis  nos  in  augmentum  diuini 
cultus  et  in  laudem  et  honorem  Domini  nostri  Jesu  Cristi  beatissiraeque 
virginis  Marie  ac  omnium  sanctorum  et  pro  salute  animarum  quondam 
nobilissimorum  patris  et  matris  nostrorum  quorum  animabus  propitietur

sione  aque  benedicte  unacum  missa  solenni  de  requie  •  et  placebo  et 
dirige  cantantur  in  vigilia  et  die  obitus  mei  annuatim  fiendi  •  Et  si 
dicti  capellani  vel  eorum  aliquis  in  premissorum  celebratione  defecerint 
seu  negligens  fuerit  procurator  comraunis  capellanorum  pro  tempore  ex- 
istens  pro  quolibet  defectu  in  sex  denariis  ipsum  deficientem  condempna- 
bit  et  alteri  capellano  ydoneo  ad  supplendum  huiusmodi  defectum  huius- 
modi  sex  denarios  dabit  •  Et  si  procurator  predictus  negligens  fuerit  pro 
qualibet  missa  omissa  duodecim  denarios  ad  commQuiam  pro  comple- 
mento  dicti  seruitii  indies  fiendi  sine  misericordia  satisfaciet  •  Et  si 
dicti  capellani  defecerint  per  octo  dies  in  celebrationibus  premissorum 
volo  extunc  prout  exnunc  quod  licebit  fratri  meo  Johanni  Strathachin 
in  Clapottis  et  suis  heredibus  presentare  unum  capellanum  ydoneum 
Episcopo  Brechinensi  pro  tempore  existenti  ad  seruiendum  ad  dictum 


CAKTJE  ORIGINALES.  169 

altare  et  ad  celebrandum  ibidem  ut  premissum  est  •  Et  insuper  omnia

Extract  of  cognitioun  furth  of  the  shireff  curt  buikis  of  Forfar  anent  the 
commonty  of  Brechin. 

CXXII.  i.^uria  vicecomitatus  de  Forfar  tenta  apud  communem  moram  de 
Brechyn  per  honorabiles  viros  Jacobum  Gray  et  Dauid  Andersoun  vice- 
comites  deputatos  de  Forfair  coniunctira  et  diuisim  vicesirao  quinto  die 
mensis  Maij  anno  Doraini  raillesimo  quingentesimo  tricesimo  quinto 
Sectis  vocatis  et  curia  legittime  affirmata  . 

In  the  quhilk  court  fornent  the  actione  mater  and  causs  persewit  be 
ane  reuerend  fader  in  God  Jhone  bischop  of  Brechyn  the  dene  chep- 
tour  and  citenaris  of  the  sarayn  be  our  souerane  lordis  lettres  direct  to

,  episcopum  cum  cousensu  capituli  sui  magistro  Joanni  Hwtoun  de  Eister

Willelmo  Broun  pertinentis  ex  orientali  Publicam  viam  dictae  Civitatis 
cx  boreali  unacum  cauda  eidem  vastae  petiae  terrae  adjacente  de  unica 
latitudine  recte  et  linealiter  descendente  ad  murum  horti  vulgo  nuncu- 
pati  the  bischopis  neyir  zarde  dyke  ex  australi  partibus  cum  pertinentiis  ; 
tenendae  in  emphiteosi  et  haereditate  imperpetuura  •  Reddendo  sum- 
mam  sex  solidorum  et  octo  denariorum  monetae  Scotiae  nomine  feodi- 
firmae  ad  duos  anni  terminos,  uecnon  haeredes  duplicando  dictam 
feodifirmam  primo  anno  eornm  introitus  ■  Data  sub  sigillo  rotundo 
dicti  episcopi  unacura  subscriptionibus  manualibus  sigilloque  communi

magistris  Joanne  Wod  Thoma  Balquhannan  Roberto  Flescher  et  Jacobo 
Cuthbert  cum  diversis  aliis  ■  16  Januarii  1566  •

CLII.  Carta  feodifirmae  concessa  per  Georgiurn  Meldrum  fllium  et  haeredem 
quondam  magistri  Georgii  Meldrura  burgensis  burgi  de  Carreill  pro 
certis  magnis  pecuniarum  summis  Joanni  Tailzour  civi  Civitatis  Bre- 
chinensis  et  Isobellae  Brown  ejus  sponsae  eorumque  alteri  diutius 
viventi  in  conjuncta  infeodatione  haeredibusque  inter  ipsos  legitime  pro- 
creatis  seu  procreandis  quibus  deficientibus  haeredibus  et  assignatis 
ipsius  Joannis  quibuscunque  borealis  dimidietatis  teneraenti  vocati  de 
antiquo  Buttergaskis  land  cum  horto  horreo  et  pertinentiis  ejusdem 
(excepta  proprietate  illarum  duarum  botharum  seu  officinarum  anteri-

dictae  Civitatis  in  feodifirma  spectantium  de  praesenti  per  Thomara 
Cowy  et  Jacobum  Clerk  occupatarura)  jacentis  ex  orientali  parte  Civi- 
tatis  praedictae  inter  terras  Sancti  Jacobi  ad  boream  terras  dicti 
Georgii  Meldrum  ad  oviens  et  australera  diraidietatera  ejusdem  tenementi 
ad  austrum  et  comraunem  viam  regiam  ad  occidens  unacum  illa  anteriori

zour  occupata  necnon  superioritatis  firraarumque  feodifirmariarum  dic-

of ;  and  setting  also,  for  the  said  space,  that  croft  of  outfield  land  called  of 
old  the  Kirk  dor  keyis,  part  of  the  patrimony  of  the  said  vicarage,  but

of  Pu^gistoun  at  the  north  and  west,  with  tUe  teind  vicarage  thereof.

Archdeacon's  Manse  (No.  CXC),  by  Mr.  John  6trachan  minister  at 
Strachan  and  archdeacon  of  Brechin,  superior  of  the  said  tenement,  and 
the  foresaid  provost  John  Skinner,  proprietor  thereof,  proceeding  upon 
No.  CXCI.,  for  new  infeftment  thereof  to  be  made  in  favour  of  the 
foresaid  Andrew  Allan,  master  of  the  said  Hospital  of  Brechin,  for  be- 
hoof  of  the  poor  therein.  Witnesses,  James  Watson  glover,  John  Mill 
merchant,  John  Spence  town-clerk  of  Brechin,  notary.     10  April  I6G7. 

CXCIV.  (^arta  qua  dictus  magister  Joannes  Strathauchin  archidiaconus  Brechi- 
nensis,  cum  consensu  antedicti  David  episcopi  ecclesiae  Brechinensis 
decani  capituli  et  canonicorum  ejusdem,  de  novo  dat  praefato  Andreae 
Allan  magistro  hospitalis  ad  usum  suprascriptum  idem  tenementum  : 
subscripta  per  dictos  archidiaconura  et  episcopum,  David  Carnegy  de- 
canura,  J.  Guild  praecentorem,  Robertum  Norie  rectorem  ecclesiae  de 
Lethnot,  Georgium  Strachan  praefectum  de  Guthrie,  David  Strachan 
thesaurarium,  R.  Stratone  rectorem  de  Phinehaven,  Herculem  Skinner 
cancellarium   ■  Testium  nominibus  non  insertis  ■   11  Aprilis  1667  . 


CAUTJE  ORIGINALES.  251 

CXCV.  i^harter  by  Robert  Laurie  bishop  of  Brechin  in  favour  of  George 
Steill  and  John  Jameson  bailies  thereof  of  those  two  tenements  of 
land,  with  the  malt  kiln  malt  barns  and  two  cobles  and  yards  thereto 
adjoining,  all  lying  contiguously  within  the  burgh  of  Brechin  at  the 
north  port  thereof,  and  east  side  of  the  high  street  of  the  same  burgh, 
bounded  by  the  arable  land  pertaining  to  the  heirs  of  the  deceased 
John  Ochterlony  late  provost  of  Brechin  at  the  east,  the  high  street  of 
the  said  city  at  the  west,  the  lands  pertaining  to  Alexander  Hendrie 
maltraan  at  the  north,  and  the  yard  pertaining  to  John  Mathers 
armourer  at  the  south  parts ;  which  lands  formerly  belonged  to  Lau- 
rence  Dundas  late  bailie  of  Brechin,  were  apprized  from  him  by  Rory 
M'enzie  advocate,  assignee  to  Kenneth  earl  of  Seaforth,  for  a  debt  of 
three  thousand  six  hundred  merks  Scots  money,  and  one  hundred  and 
twenty  pounds  of  sheriffs  fees,  and  disponed  by  the  said  Rory  M'enzie 
to  David  Skinner  bailie  of  Brechin  and  the  saids  George  Steill  and 
John  Jameson ;  to  be  held  of  the  Bishop  in  feufarm  fee  and  heritage 
for  ever,  and  for  yearly  payment  of  the  original  feuduty  thereof.  Signed 
before  witnesses,  John  Skinner  raerchant  burgess  in  Brechin,  and  the 
foresaid  John  Spence  town-clerk  thereof.  21  April  1674.    - 

CXCVI.  Instrument  of  sasine,  proceeding  upon  disposition  granted  by  Jolui 
Mill  merchant  burgess  of  Brechin  in  favour  of  James  Allan  merchant 
and  present  master  of  the  foresaid  Hospital  thereof,  for  behoof  of  the 
poor  therein,  of  those  three  roods  of  land  now  made  into  houses  and 
yards,  lying  upon  the  west  side  of  the  church  and  church  yard,  bounded 
by  the  church  yard  on  the  east,  the  brae  or  yard  pertaining  to  Alex- 
ander  Watt  glover  at  the  south,  the  said  Alexander  Watfs  other  lands

Carta  Turpini  episcopi  Brechynensis  de  ecclesia  de  veteri  Munros  . 

CXCVII.  V  niuersis  sancte  matris  ecclesie  filiis  clericis  et  laicis,  Turpinus  Dei  gratia 
episcopus  de  Brechyn  salutem  .  Sciant  tam  posteri  quam  presentes,  nos  de- 
disse  et  concessisse  et  hac  carta  nostra  confirmasse  Deo  et  ecclesie  sancti 
Thome  de  Aberbrothoc  et  monachis  ibidem  Deo  seruientibus  et  seruituris, 
ecclesiam  de  veteri  Munros  tenendam  in  liberam  et  perpetuam  elemosinam, 
cum  terris  et  decimis  et  oblacionibus  et  omnibus  iustis  pertinenciis  suis,  ita 
libere  quiete  honorifice,  sicut  aliqua  abbacia  in  toto  regno  Scotie  melius,  quie- 
cius  liberim  honorificencius  possessiones  suas  et  elemosinas  tenet  et  possidet, 
saluis  episcopalibus  .  Testibus  .  M.  episcopo  Aberdonensi,  Archenb'  abbate 
de  Dunfermelyn,  Priore  de  Brechyn  .  Andrea  capellano  de  Brechyn  .  Roberto 
capellano  regis,  Hugone  clerico  regis,  Ricardo  de  Prebenda,  Ricardo  de  Aber- 
brothoc  .  (A.D.   1178-98.)

filiis  et  fidelibus  salutem  in  Domino  .  Sciant  presentes  et  futuri  nos  dedisse  efc

ficium  in  toto  regno  Scotie  liberius  quiecius  plenius  et  honorificentius  tenent  et

eisdem  monachis  capellanos  suos  in  eisdem  ecclesiis  constituere,  saluis  episco-

Carta  Radulphi  episcopi  Brechinensis  de  procuracionibus  faciendis    . 

CCVIII  XJniuersis  sancte  matris  ecclesie  filiis  tam  presentibus  quam  futuris  R.  Dei 
gratia  Brechynensis  episcopus  salutem  in  salutis  auctore  .  Conuenerunt  nos 
abbas  et  monachi  Sancti  Thome  martiris  de  Aberbrothoc,  ostendentes  quod  ad 
quasdam  ecclesias  eorum  scilicet  ecclesiam  de  Maringtona,  ecclesiam  de 
Guthery,  ecclesiam  de  Panbryd,  ecclesiam  de  Monieky,  ecclesiam  de  Dunnech- 
tyn  sitas  in  diocesi  nostra,  nobis  causa  visitacionis  venientibus,  in  procuracione 
nostra  facienda,  tam  honeste  vt  deceret  seruire  non  possent,  cum  propter  do- 
morum  penuriam,  tum  propter  alias  quas  assignabant  rationes  .  Postulabant 
igitur  a  nobis  vt  predictarum  ecclesiarum  procuraciones  eis  remitteremus,  ita 
vt  cum  ad  aliquam  illarum  visitandam  accederemus  ;  nulla  ibi  procuracione 
exacta,  ad  domum  suam  de  Aberbrothoc  procuracionem  nostram  accepturi 
veniremus,  cum  quare  de  prefatis  ecclesiis,  post  expletum  ministerium  nostrum 
ad  abbaciam  prope  quam  site  sunt,  sine  omni  difficultate  pateret  accessius,  tum 
quare  ibi  possent  nobis  vberius  et  honestius  in  procuracione  nostra  facienda 
seruire  .  Nos  itaque  predicte  domus  de  Aberbrothoc  quam  sincera  caritate  dili- 
gimus  vtilitati  et  honori  modis  omnibus  prouidere  cupientes  abbati  et  monachis 
eiusdeni  loci  omnium  ecclesiarum  prenominatarum  procuracionis  exactionem 
penes  easdem  ecclesias,  communicato  consilio  clericorum  nostrorum  caritatis 
intuitu  onmino  remisimus  ita  vt  earundem  ecclesiarum  procuraciones  apud 
Aberbrothoc  nobis  honorifice  exhibeantur  .  Vt  autem  hec  concessio  nostra  rata 
et  inconcussa  futuris  temporibus  habeatur  ;  eam  hac  carta  nostra  coufirmauimus 
et  sigilli  nostri  apposicione  roboramus  .  Testibus  Gregorio  archidiacono,  Will- 
ehno  capellano,  Andrea  capellano  de  Brechin,  Matheo  decano,  Petro  capellano 


DE  ABERBROTHOC.  261 

nostro,  Mallebryd  Priore  Keledeorum  de  Brechin,  Willelmo  de  Kerneil  per- 
sona  de  Dunde,  Henrico  capellano  de  Munros  .    (a.  1214.) 

Confirmatio  capituli  Brechinensis  de  procuracionibus  faciendis  . 

CCIX.  Uniuersis  sancte  niatris  ecclesie  filiis  .  M.  Prior,  et  Keledei,  ceterique  de 
capitulo  Brechynensis  ecclesie  salutem  .  Sit  vniuersitati  vestre  notum,  Ra- 
dulphum  Dei  gratia  Brecbynensem  episcopum,  consilio  nostro  et  asi5ensu, 
monachis  de  Aberbrothoc  caritatis  intuitu  concessisse,  vt  quandocunque  ad 
quasdam  ecclesias  eorum,  in  diocesi  eius  sitas,  visitandas  ex  officio  venerit, 
videlicet  ad  ecclesiam  de  Marigtona,  vel  ad  ecclesiam  de  Gutheryn,  vel  ad 
ecclesiam  de  Panbryd,  vel  ad  ecclesiam  de  Moniekyn,  vel  ad  ecclesiam  de  Du- 
nechtyn,  ad  nullam  earum  hospitalitatis  ei  exhibeatur  procuracio,  sed  tantum 
ad  abbaciam,  vbi  hoc  honestius  et  decencius  fieri  potest  .  Nos  etiam  concessi- 
onem  istam  sicut  in  carta  predictorum  monachorum  melius  continetnr  omnino 
ratam  et  gratam  habemus  .  Et  in  huius  rei  testimonium,  presenti  scripto 
ecclesie  nostre  sigillum  dignum  duximus  apponendum  .  Teste  capituli  nostri 
vniuersitate  .    (o.  1214.) 

Confirmatio  Hugonis  episcopi  Brechinensis  de  procuraeionibus  faciendis    . 

CCX.  Hiis  testibus  domino  Willelrao  de  Boscho  cancellario  domini  regis,  Gregorio

ecclesiis  renunciauimus  et  quietum  clamauimus  Deo  et  monasterio  de  Abir-

episcopalibus  .  Vobimus  eciam  et  concedimus,  bona  fide  firmiter  promittentes,

quo  lesa  fuerit  in  hac  parte,  et  in  recompensacionem  vexacionum  et  expensarum

successorum  nostrorum  occasione  huius  collacionis  nullum  ius  in  predicta  ec-

nobis  et  ecclesie  de  Brechyn  deciraas  garbarum  ville  de  Bondigtona  in  predicta 
parochia  sitas,  ita  quod  nos  et  successores  nostri  et  capitulum  nostrum,  vnuni

tim  viginti  solidos  persoluent  .  Et  si  forte  quod  absit  contigerit,  quod  nos  et

questionem ;  nos  et  ecclesia  nostra  et  successores  nostri  tenemur  per  presentem 
cartam  bona  fide,  sine  dolo  et  fraude  et  omni  cauillacione,  obligati  predictis

ecclesie  Sancti  Andree  minister  supradictus  considerantes  opus  esse  caritatis,

super  eadem  deliberacione  diligenti  habita  cum  peritis,  predictam  causam 
diffinimus,  et  diffiniendo  in  forma  que  sequitur  ordinamus  .  Videlicet  quod

modi  ordinacionem  nostram,  vna  cum  omnibus  terris  et  decimis  tam  maioribus

turum  pertinere  valentibus  et  terram  de  Ysakistona  cum  suis  rectis  diuisis  ac

et  in  perpetuum  warentizabunt,  et  quadraginta  denarios  sterlingorum  annue 
pensionis  in  ecclesia  de  Dunnechtyn  predicta  in  festo  beati  Martini  in  hyeme  in 
perpetuum  percipiendos  .  Et  etiam  quod  habeat  exnunc  libere  pleno  iure  col- 
lacionem  vicariarum  ecclesiarura  de  Panbryd,  de  Kyngoldrum,  de  Monieky  et 
de  Dunnechtyn,  vicariis  earundem  ecclesiarum  nunc  existentibus,  cedentibus 
decedentibus  vel  alia  legittima  causa  amotis  .  Ita  tamen  quod  ipsi  abbas  et  con- 
uentus  predictas  ecclesias  reparabunt  et  competenter  ornabunt  .  Et  ad  minus  in 
vnaquaque  ipsarum  vnum  vestimentum  sacerdotale  competens,  cum  calice  et 
missali  sufficientibus,  iuxta  statum  ecclesie  cuiuslibet,  ponant  et  dimittant  . 
Et  si  postmodum  in  eisdem  vel  in  aliqua  ipsarum  aliqua  fuerint  emendanda  vel 
supplenda  ;  per  ipsos  vicarios  si  modica  fuerint ;  alioquin,  ab  ipsis  religiosis  pro 
duabus  partibus,  et  a  vicariis  pro  tercia  parte  suppleantur  et  reparentur  .  Et  si 
forsitan  aliquis  vicarius  de  predictis  ecclesiis,  sue  porcionis  ex  causa  sufficienti 
petierit  augmentacionem ;  non  licebit  domino  Brechynensi  episcopo  qui  pro 
tempore  fuerit,  alicuius  vicarii  porcionem  vltra  decem  libras  sterlingorum  aug- 
mentare  .  Illos  vero  vicarios  quorum  porciones  vsque  ad  decem  libras  taxate 
fuerint ;  ad  omnia  onera  ordinaria  persoluenda  volumus  obligari,  excepta  repa- 
racione  ecclesie  in  forma  superius  expressa  .  Vicarii  autem  in  predictis  ecclesiis 


268  CARTAE  DE   ECCLESIIS 

nunc  existenles,  liac  ordinacione  nostra  non  obstante,  porcionibus  nunc  habitis, 
temporibus  suis  sint  contenti  .  Preterea  ordinando  diffinimus  et  diffiniendo 
ordinamus,  quod  abbas  et  conuentus  monasterii  de  Aberbrothoc  predicti  habe- 
ant  teneant  et  possideant,  libere  quiete  et  pacifice,  rectorias  seu  personatus 
ecclesiarum  predictarum  de  Panbryd,  Monieky,  Kyngoldrum,  et  de  Dunnechtyn, 
in  perpetuum  absque  aliquo  ordinario  onere,  saUia  tamen  episcopo  Brechynensi 
qui  pro  tempore  fuerit  iurisdictione  racione  dictarum  rectoriarum  siue  persona- 
tuum  sibi  de  iure  competente  statuto  vel  consuetudine  .  Item  ordinamus  et 
ordinando  diffinimus,  quod  omnes  carte  et  instrumenta,  si  quas  vel  que  habet 
ecclesia  Brechynensis  memorata,  que  sibi  plus  iuris  tribuunt  in  quatuor  rectoriis 
superius  nominatis  quam  in  huiusmodi  ordinacione  nostra  exprimitur,  et  versa 
vice,  si  predicti  abbas  et  conuentus  aliqua  habeant  instrumenta,  que  eis  plus 
iuris  tribuunt  in  ecclesiis  de  Katerlyn,  et  de  Marigtona  ac  terris  et  decimis 
earundem  superius  expi-essis,  quam  in  huiusmodi  ordinacione  continetur  ;  de 
cetero  nullius  sint  roboris  aut  firmitatis  .  Insuper  ordinamus  et  ordinando  dif- 
finimus,  quod  partes  memorate  contra  huiusmodi  ordinacionem  nostram,  nullis 
futuris  temporibus  directe  vel  indirecte  venire  presumant,  sed  eam  diligenter 
firmiter  ac  fideliter  pro  toto  posse  suo  in  virtute  iuramenti  prestiti  obseruent, 
sub  pena  mille  librarum  sterlingorum  camere  domini  pape  a  parte  contra  pre- 
sentem  ordinacionem  seu  diffinicionem  veniente,  in  subsidium  terre  sancte 
soluendarum  .  Et  nichilominus  si  aliquis  episcopus  Brechynensis  qui  pro  tem- 
pore  fuei-it,  contra  ipsam  ordinacionem  seu  diffinicionem  venerit,  seu  ad  aliquem 
actum  ad  hoc  ordinatum,  cum  effectu  procedendo,  venire  attemptauerit ;  liceat 
abbati  monasterii  de  Aberbrothoc  predicti,  omnes  possessiones  redditus  atque 
iura,  per  hanc  ordinacionem  seu  diffinicionem  nostram  ecclesie  Brechynensia  de 
nouo  assignata,  per  se  vel  alium  quemcunque  auctoritate  propria,  libere  et  sine 
impedimento  quocunque  ingredi  ac  occupare,  et  etiam  de  eisdem  libere  disponere, 
prout  ante  hanc  ordinacionem  nostram  seu  diffinicionem,  disponere  consueuit, 
nullius  penitus  licencia  petita  vel  optenta  .  Preterea  diffiniendo  ordinamus,  et 
ordinando  diffinimus,  quod  partes  predicte,  hanc  nostram  ordinacionem  seu 
diffinicionem  sumptibus  communibus  quam  cito  poterunt,  per  sedem  apostolicam 
specialiter  confirmari  procurent  .  Partes  vero  predicte  premissis  omnibus  coram 
ipsis  lectis  et  diligenter  recitatis  ;  ea  omnia  et  singula  acceptauerunt  laudaue- 


DE   ABERBROTHOC.  269 

runt  et  approbauerunt  .  Et  etiam  ad  ipsorum  omnium  et  singulorum  obserua- 
cionem  in  perpetuum  sub  penis  premissis  in  virtute  iuramenti  prestiti,  se 
specialiter  obligauerunt  et  expresse  .  In  quorum  omnium  testimonium  huic 
ordinacioni  penes  ecclesiam  Brechynensem  in  perpetuum  remanenti,  sigillum 
nostrum  vna  cum  sigillo  communi  monasterii  predicti  fecimus  apponi  .  Et 
eidem  ordinacioni  nostre  penes  supradictum  monasteinum  in  perpetuum  residenti, 
sigillum  nostrum  vna  cura  sigillo  venerabilis  patris  domini  Johannis  Dei  gratia 
Brechynensis  episcopi  supradicti  et  communi  sigillo  capituli  Brechynensis  est 
appensum  .  Actum  et  ordinatum  ac  diffinitum  in  capitulo  monasterii  de  Abir- 
brothoc  vicesimo  primo  die  Octobris  .  Anno  gratie  millesimo  treeentesimo 
quarto  .

iug  on  the  narrative  that  he  had  sold  to  Robert  CoIIace  of  Balnamone  and

failing  to  the  heirs  and  assignees  of  the  said  Robert  whomsoever,  all  and  whole 
the  lauds  of  Fyndowry  with  the  pertinents  (No.  CCXXXVI.)  ;  to  be  holden  of 
him  his  heirs  and  assignees,  and  paying  therefor  yearly  to  the  Canons  and  Chapter

of  Brechin  tliirty  shillings  of  money,  to  William  Dempster  of  Carrald- 
stoune  his  heirs  and  assignees  ten  pounds  ten  shillings  at  tvvo  usual  terms  in 
the  year,  and  to  him  the  said  David  Fentoun  his  heirs  successors  and  assignees 
one  penny  money  of  Scotland  in  name  of  blench  farm ;  and  that  the  said  Robert 
Collace  had  sold  to  him  the  said  David  Fentoiin  the  half  of  the  lands  of  the 
Mains  of  Balnamone  under  reversion  on  the  payment  of  the  sum  of  five 
hundred  merks  money  foresaid,  which  half  lands  he  had  set  to  the  said 
Robert  CoUace  for  forty  bolls  victual,  half  meal  half  bear,  to  be  paid 
yearly ;  therefore  binding  himself  to  warrant  the  saids  lands  of  Fyndowry 
to  the  said  Robert  Collace  and  his  spouse  free  of  all  bygone  duties,  and 
if  they  be  evicted  from  the  saids  lands,  to  infeft  them  iu  otber  lands 
of  equal  value  and  convenience,  and  also,  if  diiring  the  occupation  of  the  saids 
lands  by  tbe  tacksman  thereof  they  cannot  profit  therefrom,  to  pay  them  yearly 
three  chalders  eight  bolls  victual,  two  parts  meal,  and  the  third  part  bear ;  and 
that  under  the  penalty  of  five  hundred  merks.  Said  obligation  is  subscribed  at 
Balnamone  the  sixteenth  day  of  February  one  thousand  five  hundred  and  sixty 
two  years  before  witnesses  Robert  CoUace  younger,  Henrie  Chalmer,  Johnne 
Scott  and  Sir  Walter  Fairwodder  notary  public,  and  registered  in  the  sheriff 
court  books  of  Forfar  22d  May,  1563.

CCXLI.  Conti-act  of  sale  between  Robert  Arbuthnot  of  that  ilk  on  the  one  part,  and 
Robert  Cullaice  of  Balnamowne,  Elizabeth  Bruice  his  spouse  with  his  consent, 
and  John  Cullaice  his  son  and  apparent  heir,  on  the  other  part,  by  which  the 
said  Robert  Cullaice,  in  consideration  of  the  sum  of  seven  thousand  five  liun- 
dred  merks  Scots  money,  binds  himself,  with  consent  of  his  said  son,  to  infeft 
the  said  Robert  Arbuthnot  of  that  ilk  and  Heline  Cleponne  his  spouse  and  the 
longest  liver  of  them  in  liferent,  and  David  Arbuthnot  their  son,  and  his  heirs 
male  in  fee  in  the  foresaids  town  and  lands  of  Fyndowrie  with  the  pertinents, 
as  then  occupied  and  laboured  by  the  said  John  Cullaice  and  his  subtenants  ;  to 
be  holden  of  the  said  Robert  Cullaice  and  his  heirs  in  free  blench  for  payment 
to  the  Canons  and  Chapter  of  Brechin  and  their  successors  of  the  sum  of  thirty 
sbillings,  and  to  William  Dempster  of  Caneddistoune  his  heirs  or  successors, 
8upei'iors  of  the  saids  lands,  of  the  sum  of  ten  pounds  ten  shillings  Scots 
money  ;  and  also,  in  warrandice  thereof,  in  the  quarter  lands  of  Balconnall  and 
shadow  quarter  lands  of  Balfour  lying  in  the  parish  of  Menmoir  and  sheriff- 
dom  of  Forfar  with  the  pertinents.  Signed  at  Brechin  before  these  witnesses, 
Mr.  Alexander  Arbuthnot  pi*incipal  of  the  college  of  Aberdeen,  Alexander 
Vedderborne  common  clerk  of  Dundee,  George  Barclay  of  Seyid,  Mr.  William 
Davidsoune  burgess  of  Aberdeen,  and  Mr.  Alexander  Davidsoune,  9th  Feb- 
ruary  1574.

CCXLIX  Tack  by  Alesander  Bishop  of  Brechin,  v.itli  consent  of  the  dean  and  canoiis  of 
the  Chapter  of  the  Cathedral  thereof,  to  James  Arbuthnott  portioner  of  Arrott 
of  the  teind  sheaves  of  the  mains  and  lands  of  Arrott  and  Lichtounhili  and 
sunny  half  of  the  mill  and  mill  lands  of  Arrott  with  the  pertinents,  and  that  for 
the  space  of  nineteen  years  following  the  term  of  Lammas,  called  Petri  ad 
vincula,  in  the  year  one  thousand  five  hundred  and  ninety-six,  and  thereafter 
for  the  lifetimes  of  the  said  James  Arbuthnott  and  his  two  sueeeeding  heirs 
male,  and  to  the  heirs  or  assignees  of  the  last  heir  for  the  space  of  other  two 
nineteen  years,  for  payment  of  the  yearly  tack  duty  of  forty-two  bolls  victual, 
two  parts  nieal  and  the  third  part  bear,  or,  at  the  rate  of  thirteen  shillings  and 
four  pence  Scots  money  for  every  boll,  ol'  the  suni  in  whole  of  forty-two  merks 


CARTAE  MISCELLANEAE.  291 

Scots  money  at  the  term  of  Caudleraas,  called  the  purification  of  the  Virgiu 
Mary,  next  after  the  separation  of  eveiy  crop  from  the  ground.  Said  tack  is 
subscribed  by  the  said  Bishop  and  Chapter  at  Donde  before  these  witnesses, 
Dauid  Arbuthnott  of  Findowrye,  James  Arbuthnot  his  brother,  George  Camp- 
bell  of  Crownan,  and  Dauid  Gampbell  of  Denheid,  lOth  June  1596. 


CCL.  Grift  under  the  privy  seal  to  Robert  Arbuthiiot  fiar  of  that  ilk,  his  heirs 
and  assignees,  of  the  non-entry  duties  of  the  foresaid  lands  of  Findowrie  with 
their  pertinents,  arising  during  the  time  the  saids  lands  had  beeu  in  the  hands 
of  the  Bishops  of  Brechin  superiors  thereof,  before  tho  annexation  of  cliurch 
lands  to  the  Crown,  or  after  saiJ  annexation,  through  the  decease  of  Williame 
Dempster  of  Cari'etstoun,  last  lawful  and  immediate  tenant  to  the  Bishop  of 
Brechin  therein  or  his  predecessors,  and  for  all  years,  until  the  lawful  entry  of 
the  rightful  heir  or  heirs  of  the  said  Williame  Dempster  or  his  predecessors 
-   thereto.     Dated  8th  September,  1599. 


CCLI.  DecTeet  of  the  Lords  of  Coancil  and  Session,  at  the  instance  of  Alexander 
Bishop  of  Brechin,  against  Mr.  Johnne  Prestoun  of  Fentoun  Bernis,  his  Ma- 
jesty's  CoUector-general,  finding  that  the  said  Bishop  had  right,  by  virtue  of 
a  grant  of  the  superiority  of  the  bishopric  made  in  his  favour  by  the  King  and 
Estates  of  Parliament  in  November  one  thousand  five  hundred  and  ninety- 
seven  years,  to  the  mails  and  Juties  of  his  said  bishopric  for  the  years  one 
thousand  five  hundred  and  ninety-eight,  one  thousanJ  five  hundred  and  ninety- 
nine,  one  thousand  six  hundred,  one  thousand  six  hundred  and  one,  and  one 
thousand  six  hundred  and  two,  which  mails  and  duties  had  been  claimed  by 
the  said  Collector  in  virtue  of  the  annexation  of  church  lands  to  the  Crown. 
Said  decreet  is  dated  Ist  February  1603.

CCLV-  Presentation  of  Alexander  Bissat  minister  at  the  kirk  of  Brechin  to  the 
parsonage  aud  vicarage  of  Kylmoir,  with  the  emoluments,  manse,  and  glebe 
thereof,  by  John  Livingstoun  of  Donypace  patron  thereof,  proceeding  on 
the  naiTative  that  the  persons  dwelling  formerly  within  the  parish  of  Kylmoir 
were  then  within  the  parish  of  Brechin,  and  there  received  the  word  and  sa- 
craments,  and  that  the  said  vicarage  and  parsonage  was  vacant  by  the  decease 
of  Mr.  Andrew  Leich,  last  parson  and  vicar  thereof.  Signed  before  these 
witnesses,  John  Straitoun  fiar  of  Lowrenstoun,  David  Barclay  of  Matheris, 
Patrik  Levingstoun  of  Balrowny,  Peter  Blair  in  Lichtownhill,  and  John  Noray 
notary  in  Brechin,  26  October,  1611. 


CARTAE  MISCELLANEAE.  297 


CCLVI.  Presentation  by  Andrew,  bishop  of  Brechin,  in  favour  of  the  said  Mr.  Alex- 
ander  Bissat  to  the  said  parsonage  and  vicarage  of  Kylmoir,  signed  before 
witnesses,  James  Lamb,  his  brother,  John  Langall  citizen  of  Brechin,  John 
Noray  notary  there,  and  John  Ramsay  commissary  thereof,  10  February  1612. 


CCLVIL  Carta  concessa  per  Joannem  Lewingstoun  feodatarium  de  Caldhame  pro  summa 
duo  mille  mercarum  monetae  Scotiae,  sub  reversionis  conditiono,  tamen,  spe- 
cificata  in  contractu  inito  inter  illura  et  Robertum  Rollok  juniorem  civem 
Civitatis  Brechinensis,  dicto  Roberto  Rollok  et  Margaretae  Ouchterlowny  ejus 
sponsae  eorumque  alteri  diutius  viventi  in  conjuncta  infeodatione  haeredibus- 
que  inter  ipsos  legitime  procreatis  seu  procreandis  quibus  deficientibus  haere- 
dibus  dicti  Roberti  et  assignatis  quibuscunque  unius  annui  redditus  ducen- 
tarum  mercarum  mouetae  Scotiae  levandi  ad  festum  penthecostes  de  terris 
suis  de  Caldbame  ;  tenendi  de  dicto  Johanne  Lewingstoun  in  libera  alba  firma 
feodoque  et  haereditate  imperpetuum  .  Haec  cai"ta  continens  in  se  praeceptum 
saisinae  data  est  coram  his  testibus  Joanne  Owdny  de  Kethik,  Joanne  Noray 
notario  publico  in  Breehin,  Joanne  Ouchterlowny  fratre  dictae  Margaretae, 
et  David  Liddell  et  Thoma  Ogiluy  civibus  dictae  Civitatis,  16  Junii  1621   . 


CCLVIII.  Disposition  by  John  Mortimer  sometime  of  Craigivar  to  Robert  Arbuthnot 
of  Findowrie  of  his  desk  and  seat  in  the  kirk  of  Breichine,  south-west  from 
the  pulpit  thereof,  which  sometime  pertained  to  Symer  of  Balzordie, 

vvith  the  ground  whereon  the  same  stands,  but  reserving  the  liferent  use 
thereof  to  himself  and  Helen  Symer  his  spouse  ;  signed  before  these  wit- 
nesses,  Alesander  Forbes  burgess  of  Aberdeen,  Arthur  Straton  writer  to  his 
Majesty's  signet,  and  Robert  Hagie  his  servant,  10  July  1629  .

ministrum  verbi  Dei  ecclesiae  Brechinensis  ac  magistrum  hospitii  pauperum

dictae  Civitatis  Brechinensis  in  favorem  Roberti  vicecomitis  de  Arbutlinot 
Joniini  de  Bervie  legitirai  et  propinquioris  baeredis  domini  Roberti  Arbuthnot 
de  eodem  militis  sui  patris  in  terris  de  Magdillane  Chappell  alias  voeatis 
Chappeltoun  cum  domibus  aeditieiis  et  pertiuentiis  annexatis  et  ineorporatis  ad

parochia  de  Brechin  infra  vicecomitatum  de  Forfar,  unacum  piscatione  ejusdem 
in  aqua  de  Eske  vulgo  lie  Willokishill  nuncupata,  ac  cum  raora  dictarum  ter-

datum  est  circa  1650  .

possessionem  unius  tenemenli,  quod  fuerat  olim  prefati  Alexandri,  jacentis

DUNDEE .

Concessio  Regia  episcopatus  Brechinensis  Alexandro  Campbell  . 

CCLXXXVI.  Menricus  et  Maria  Dei  gratia  etc.  Quia  dedimus  concessimus  et  disposuimus 
predilecto  nostro  Alexandro  Campbell  fratri  Jacobi  Carapbell  de  Ardkinglas 
pro  omnibus  vite  sue  diebus  Totum  et  integrum  beneficium  episcopatus 
Brechinensis  cum  omnibus  et  singulis  terris  terrisque  dominicalibus  castris 
turribus  fortaliciis  maneriebus  siluis  molendinis  piscariis  annuis  redditibus 
ecclesiis  decimis  garbalibus  aliisquc  decimis  fructibus  redditibus  prouentibus 
emolimentis  firmis  canis  custumis  proficuis  et  deuoriis  eidem  spectantibus  ei 
pertinentibus  tam  spiritualitatis  quam  temporalitatis  eiusdem  Ac  cum  potestate 
sibi  dare  et  disponere  singula  beneficia  dignitates  aut  alia  infra  diocesim 
Brechinensem  nunc  vacantia  aut  quando  eadem  vacare  contigerit  que  prius 
donationi  episcoporum  Brechinensium  pertinuerunt  Quiquidem  episeopatu.s

CCXCVI.  Letter  made  with  advice  of  my  Lord  Regent  and  with  consent  of  the  eomp- 
trollar,  making  mention  that  Mathew  Hepburne  chaplain  of  the  chaplainry  of 
Caldhame  had,  in  giving  in  the  rental  thereof  for  the  sum  of  forty  merks, 
defrauded  our  Sovereign  Lord  of  a  great  part  of  the  just  third  thei-eof  for 
several  years  bypast,  by  making  payment  to  the  comptrollar  of  only  the 
third  of  the  said  forty  merks,  albeit  the  said  Mathew  during  that  time  had  got 
for  the  said  cliaplainry  xxvii  raerks  and  six  chalders  of  bear,  and  therefore 
granting  to  Mr.  Johnne  Cokbui'ne  citizon  of  Brechin  his  heirs  and  assignees 
the  surplus  pertaining  to  our  said  Sovereign  Lord  of  the  said  chapLainry, 
omitted  from  the  rental  thereof  for  tlie  years  M  v°  Ixi,  Ixii,  Ixiii,  and  Ixiiii. 
Dated  at  Edinburght  20  January  1567.

CCCXXXVII.  Gift  for  life  to  Mr.  Alexander  Nory  of  tlie  feu  mails  of  tbe  lands  of  Cortachie 
with  the  pertinents  lying  within  the  diocese  of  Erechin  and  sheriifdom  of 
Forfar,  formerly  jrranted  by  the  predecessors  of  the  Lord  of  Brechyn  to  three 
chaplainries  of  the  choir  of  Brechin  and  six  bairns  to  be  sustained  at  the 
school  to  sing  in  the  said  choir,  with  the  houses  and  yards  belonging  to  the 
saids  chaplainries  and  formerly  belonging  to  Johnne  sometime  Earl  of  Mar, 
as  undoubted  patron  thereof,  and  now  to  the  King  by  reason  of  escheat 
through  a  process  of  forfeiture  of  which  the  said  Earl  was  convicted  in  Parlia- 
ment.     Dated  at  Falkland  9th  September  1584.

CCC  XL  VI.  Praeceptum  cartae  confirmationis  super  carta  feudifirmae  facta  a  dieto  quondam 
Johaune  episcopo  Brechinensi  cum  consensu  praedicto  Carolo  Murray  filio  et 
liaeredi  apparenti  Willelmi  Murray  et  sponsae  [cjus]  Mai'garetae  Gardin  do- 
minae  Kellie  ac  Mariotae  Auchtirlony  sponsae  dicti  Caroli  eorumque  alteri

cum  pertinentiis  quibuscunque  jacentium  in  baronia  de  Kethik  et  dominio  de

copo  et  suis  successoribus  iu  feuditirma  et  haereditate  impei-petuum  etc.  . 
Datum  apud  Striuiling  20  Octobris  1585  .

CCGLIX.  Grant  to  Robert  Low,  servant  to  James  Meldrum  of  Segie,  his  heirs  and  as-

disponed  to  Lawrence  Dundas  citizen  of  Brechin  and  ILargaret  Wischart  his 
spouse  their  heirs  and  assignees,  of  the  teind  sheaves  of  the  twenty  acres 
of  land  with  the  pertinents  formerly  belonging  to  the  chaplainries  of  Sir 
Williame  Rynd  and  Sir  Williame  Carnegie,  two  of  the  chaplains  of  the  chap- 
lainry  of  St.  Mary  founded  within  the  said  city,  called  the  Masindew  (now 
heritably  pertainining  to  the  said  Robert  Low)  which  tack  had  fallen  to  the 
King  in  consequence  of  the  said  Lawrence  nnd  his  spouse  having  been  put  to 
the  horn  by  virtue  of  Ictters  in  the  four  forms  raised  at  the  instance  of 
Johnne  Low  son  and  heir  to  the  deceased  Johnne  Low  citizen  of  Brechin  and 
the  said  Robert  Low  his  tutor.     Dated  at  Halieruidhous  12th  Februarv,  1586.

dictam  portam  Ergadie  [ad  boream] ;  jacentibus  in  barronia  de  Dundie  infra  vice-

cessoribus  in  feudifirma  et  bereditate  etc.  .  Apud  Halieruidhous  decimo  octauo 
die  mensis  Aprilis  anno  Domini  millesimo  quingentesimo  octuagesimo  septimo  .

CCCLXXIX.  "raeceptum  cartae  confinnationis  unius  cartae  factae  ab  Alexandro  episcopo 
Brechinensi  cum  consensu  capituli  et  canonicorum  eeclesiae  cathedralis  Bre- 
chinensis  Alexandro  Ogilvie  in  Drummes  haeredibus  suis  et  assignatis  tertiae 
partis  de  Eister  Drummes  tunc  occupatae  ab  Alexandro  Ogilvie  seniore,  ac 
tertiae  partis  morae  vulgo  lie  Firth  nuncupatae  cum  suis  pertinentiis,  ja- 
centium  in  dominio  episcopatus  Brechinensis  infra  vicecomitatum  de  Forfair ; 
et  aliae  cartae  umbralis  dimidietatis  earundem  terrarum  concessae  a  dicto 
Alexandro  Ogiluie  seniore  portionario  de  Eister  Drummes  Alexandro  Ogilvie 
juniori  eius  filio  natu  maximo  et  quondam  Agneti  Edmonstoun  ejus  conjugi 
ac  eorum  alteri  diutius  viventi  ipsorumque  haeredibus  quibus  deficientibus 
haeredibus  dicti  Alexandri  Ogilvie  junioris  quibuscunque,  et  solaris  dimidie- 
tatis  earundem  terrarum  dicto  Alexandro  Ogilvie  juniori  haeredibus  suis  et 
assignatis  quibuscunque  ;  tenendarum  de  dicto  episcopo  et  suis  successoribus 
in  feodifirma  et  haereditate  imperpetuum  .  Reddendo  inde  annuatim  domino 
Regi  et  successoribus  suis  duas  celdras  victuahum,  octo  bollas  ordei,  viginti 
(luatuor  bollas  farinae  avenaticae,  et  unam  duodenam  pultrearum,  ad  ter- 
minos  consuetos,  vel  decem  marcas  monetae  Scotiae  pro  qualibet  celdra  vic- 
tualium  et  quatuor  denarios  pro  qualibet  dictarum  pultrearum,  necnon  sum- 
mam  trium  soHdorum  et  quatuor  denariorum  monetae  praedictae  in  annuam 
augmentationem  rentalis ;  ac  etiam  praestando  tres  sectas  curiae  ad  tria 
placita  capitalia  dominii  de  Brechin  ;  et  similiter  seruiendo  Regi  et  succes- 
soribus  suis  et  locumtenentibus  pro  tempore  in  guerris  et  exercitibus  regalibus 
toties  quoties  opus  fuerit  armati  rebus  bellicis,  nomine  feodifirmae  tantum  . 
Datum  apud  Haliruidhous  6  Januarii  1591  . 


CCCLXXX.  Gift  for  seven  years  to  Charles  Foulertoun  student,  son  to  the  deceased  Mr, 
James  Foulertoun,  for  his  support  at  the  schools  and  for  his  upbringing  in 
science  and  good  letters,  of  the  teinds  of  the  lands  of  Clayleck,  extending 
yearly  to  the  sum  of  eight  merks  Scots,  and  formei-ly  pertaining  in  common 
to  the  canons  of  Brechin.  •  Dated  at  Dalkeith  21st  August  1592.

regiis  pro  tempore  vbi  contigerint,  et  deferendo  eorum  grana  que  crescere 
contigerint  super  fundo  predictarum  terrarum  ad  molendinum  vocatum  the 
Milndene  molenda  pro  solutione  astrictarum  multuram  .  .  ,  Apud  Haliruidhous 
quarto  die  mensis  Martii  anno  Domini  millesimo  quingentesimo  nonagesimo 
septimo  . 


CCCXCII.  King  James  VI.  grants  of  new  to  David  Earl  of  Craufurd  the  barony  of 
Fynevin,  which  he  had  resigned  in  August,  1597,  including  the  lodging  and 
tenement  of  land  called  the  EarFs  Lodging  lying  in  the  burgh  of  Dundie 
upon  the  south  side  of  the  parish  kirk  thereof,  with  the  advocation,  donation, 
and  right  of  patronage  of  the  chaplainry  founded  within  the  said  lodging,  an 
annual  rent  of  one  hundred  merks  money  foresaid  yearly  to  be  uplifted  furth 
of  his  Majesty's  great  customs  of  the  burgh  of  Dundie,  with  the  craig  called 


CARTAE  MISCELLANEAE.  373 

Saint  Nicolas'  Craig  within  the  sea  mark  of  the  sald  burgh  of  DunJie,  a.id 
with  the  fortalice  and  place  of  the  said  craig,  advocation,  donation,  and  right 
of  patronage  of  the  chaplainry  of  St.  Nicolas  founded  vvithin  the  same,  together 
with  the  advocation,  donation,  and  right  of  patronage  of  five  chaplainries  of  St. 
George  the  Martyr  and  of  Allhallovv  chaplainry  founded  within  the  said  parish 
kirk  of  Dundie.     At  Halyrudhous  9th  March,  1597.

CCOXCIV.  King  James  VI.,  on  the  narrative  that  the  temporalities  of  all  bishoprics  had 
been  annexed  to  the  Crown,  that  the  canis  customs  and  casualtics  are  found 
by  his  Majesty  and  the  Lords  Commissioners  of  the  annexed  lands  to  pertain 
absolutely  to  his  Highness  without  any  satisfaction  heing  due  therefor,  and  that 
the  other  rents  required  satisfaction  to  the  present  possessors,  boll  for  boll  and 
penny  for  penny  ;  and  Ijnowing  that  Alexander  Campbell  is  duly  provided  to 
the  bishopric  of  Brechin,  vvhereof  if  the  saids  canis  and  customs  should  be 
taken  from  him  without  any  satisfaction,  the  remainder  of  his  temporalitv 
being  altogether  exhausted  with  pensions  and  other  provisions  made  therefrom 
to  private  persons  by  his  predecessors,  he  would  be  lieavily  prejudged  and 
damaged  in  his  said  living,  against  the  tenor  of  the  said  act  of  annexation  and 
intention  of  the  three  estates  at  their  consent  thereto ;  grants  to  the  bishop 
for  hfe  the  temporality  of  the  said  beneiicei  as  well  the  revenue  thereof  in 
victual  and  money,  if  there  be  any,  as  the  saids  canis,  customs,  poultry,  entries 


CARTAE  MISCELLANEAE.  375 

of  tenants,  and  other  casualties  whatsoever  of  whieh  he  was  ia  possession 
before  the  act  of  annexation,  with  power  to  uplift  all  the  profits  due  to  the 
King  as  superior,  for  payment  yearly  of  forty  merks  Scots  to  the  crown. 
Dated  at  Haliruidhous  2nd  April,  1598  [1588  1]

CCCXCVIII.  King  James  VI.  grants  to  John  Gairdin  student  in  Montrois  for  seven  years,

belonging  to  the  commonty  of  the  chanonry  of  Brechin,  with  entry  at  Whit- 
Runday,  1599.     At  Hammiltoun  30th  August,  1599.

Brechine  callit  the  Pensionarie  fundit  within  the  said  kirk,  sumtyme  possessit

and  sindrie  maillis  rentis  proffeittis  and  dewteis  pertening  thairto  vsit  and 
wonnt,  now  vacand  in  oure  handis  be  deceis  of  the  said  umquhile  Mr.  Jhonne 
Layng  last  prebender  and  possessour  thairof,  and  also  gewand  .  .  .  to  the

awand  unpayit  sen  the  deceis  of  the  said  umquhile  Mr.  Jhonne  Layng  &c.  .  .  .

Ane    Inchibitioun   for   halding    off  mercats    of   Stapillhand  at  Brechine  and 
Fordoune. 

CCCCIII.  Dauid  Dei  gratia  Re.\  Scottorum  justiciariis  vicecomitibus  ac  ceteris  vniuersis 
et  singulis  ministris  nostris  etfidelibus  ad  quorum  noticiam  presentes  litere  per- 
uenerint  .  Salutem  .  Quia  compertum  fuit  in  vltimo  itinere  camerarie  tento 
apud  Monross,  quod  fora  communia  rerum  venalium  tenentur  et  exercentur 
apud  Brechine  et  Fordoune  in  preiudicium  nostrum  et  burgi  nostri  do  Monros 


CARTAE  MISCELLANEAE.  381 

dampnum  et  grauamen  ;  vobis,  et  vnicuique  vestrum  precipimus  et  mandamus 
quatinus,  cum  per  predicti  burgi  nostri  burgenses  fueritis  requisiti  vel  necessi- 
tatem  videritis  eminere,  dicta  loca  personaliter  adeatis,  et  ibidem  publice  pro- 
clamari  faciatis,  ex  parte  nostra  firmiter  inhibentes,  nequis  de  cetero  apud 
Brechyne,  de  lana,  coriis,  aut  pellibus  lanatis,  aut  apud  Fordoiine,  vel  in  quo- 
cunque  alio  loco  infra  raetas  et  bundas  dicti  burgi  nostri  de  Monros  per  pre- 
decessores  nostros  Reges  Scotie  concessas  et  limitatas,  de  quibuscunque  rebus 
venalibus,  nobis  magnam  vel  paruam  custumam  debentibus,  fora  aliqualiter 
teneat,  foueat,  aut  exerceat,  vel  illuc  premissa  emendo  vel  vendendo  accessum 
habeat  .  Et  si  forte  aliqua  premissa  in  dictis  locis  in  antea  inuenire  poteritis 
venalia,  illa  bona,  tanquam  escaetam,  arrestare  et  obseruari  faciatis,  in  usus 
nostros  penitus  conuertenda,  et  absque  replegiatione  aliqua  applicanda  . 
Ementes  huiusmodi  et  vendentes,  et  prenominata  fora  illicita  fouentes  attach- 
ietis  ad  calumpniara  nostram  personaliter  responsuros  .  Baronibus  insuper 
nostris  liberetenentibus  et  vniuersis  et  singulis  hominibus  nostris  firmiter  in- 
hibemus,  nequis  dicta  fora,  seu  aliqua  alia  huiusmodi  illicita,  foueat,  adeat, 
aut  consilio,  vel  auxilio,  clam  vel  palam,  aliqualiter  manutenere,  vel  exercere 
presumat,  contra  presentem  inhibicionem  nostram,  sub  pena  omnium  que  ero-a 
nos  am[itti  p]oterunt  quoquo  modo  .  Et  hec  in  fide  et  fidelitate  [quibus] 
nobis  tenemini  et  tenentur  nullo  modo  omittatis,  nec  omittant  .  In  cuius  rei 
testimonium  presentibus  literis  nostris,  penes  predictos  burgenses  nostros  per- 
petuo  remansuris,  apponi  precepimus  sigillura  nostrum  .  Apud  Sconam  v'° 
die  Marcii  anno  regni  nostri  vicesimo  tercio  .

Sir  Thomas  Thoulace,  in  the  name  and  behawe  of  ane  honorabill  man  James 
Arbuthnot  of  that  ilk,  the  sowme  of  xxxv  merkis  gud  and  vsual  mone  of

waird  of  the  marriage  of  the  said  James  pertening  to  us,  of  the  quhilk  sowme 
we  hald  us  weil  content  and  pait,  and  be  this  our  acquittance  quitclamis  and 
dischargis  the  said  James  <and  all  otheris  of  the  said  composicioune  and  teind 
penny  for  now  and  ever.  In  witnes  of  quhilk  we  have  subscrivit  this  acquit- 
tanee  witlx  our  handis  at  Brechin  the  penult  of  Maij  in  the  zeir  of  God 
M  V''  and  xi  zeris,  befor  thir  witnes,  maister  Thomas  Meldrum  chancellair  of

persone  of  Butliirgill,  and  Schir  Thomas  Thoulace  with  others  diuers,  and  for

saidis  witues,  day  zeir  and  place  forsaid.

Inquisitio  . 

CCCCIX.  Hec  Inquisitio  facta  fuit  in  pretorio  burgi  de  Inuerheruie  corain  nobili  et 
potenti  domino  Willelmo  comite  Mariscalli  vicecomite  principali  de  Kincardine 
et  Dauid  Barclay  de  Matheris  eius  deputato  4°  die  Martii  A.D.  1554°  de 
mandato  literarum  sancte  domine  nostre  Regine  sub  signeto,  ex  deliberatione 
dominorum  concilii  dicto  vicecomiti  directarum,  per  probos  et  fideles  homine.s 
patrie  subscriptos,  videlicet,  Archibaldum  Douglas  de  Glcnberuie,  Robertum 
Arbuthnot  de  eodem,  Johannem  Wischart  de  Pittarro,  Johannem  Strathauchin 
de  Thorntoun,  Georgium  Strattoun  de  eodem,  Dauid  Wod  de  Crage,  Dauid 
Barclay  de  Matheris,  Robertum  Graham  de  Morphie,  Johannem  Strathauchiti 
de  Monboddaw,    Walterum  Bisset  feoditarium  de  Eister  Kynneif,  vVndream

Stewart  de  Logyeowye,  Robertum  Maluill  de  Haruistoun,  Willelmum  Hay  de

Johannem  Middiltoun  in  Kilbill,  et  Robertum  Keyth  in  Barnebill  .  Qui  jurati 
dicunt  quod  quoad  literas  dominorum  temporalium  referunt  se  Inquisitioni 
antiquitus  facte  per  eorum  predeeessores  super  retornationem  antiqui  extentus 
dictarum  terrarum  dominorum  temporalium,  videlicet,  Quod  terre  Parke  de

LITERAE    PAPALES. 


CCCCX.  Bull  by  Honorius  III.  granted  on  account  of  the  devotion  manifested  by  Alex- 
ander  King  of  Scots  and  his  predecessors  to  the  Holy  See,  whereby  in  accord- 
ance  with  the  example  of  his  predecessors  Celestine  and  Innocent,  and  con- 
sidering  that  the  Scottish  Church,  in  which  there  were  these  episcopal  sees,  to 
wit,  the  churchea  of  St.  Andrews,  Dumblane,  Glasgow,  Dunkeld,  Brechin, 
Abardeen,  Murray,  Ross,  and  Caithness,  was  subject  inimediately  to  the 
Apostolic  iSee,  the  Pope  rigorously  prohibits  any  one,  except  the  Roman 
Pontiff  or  his  Legate  a  latere  appointed  for  Scotland,  from  promulgating  a 
sentence  of  Interdict  or  Excommunication  in  that  kingdom,  declaring  it  to  be 
null  if  promulgated  ;  and  adds,  also,  that  it  shall  not  be  lawful  for  anypersons, 
who  do  not  belong  to  that  kingdom,  unless  one  specially  appointed  by  the 
Apostolic  See  out  of  its  own  body  for  that  end,  to  exercise  the  office  of  Legate 
in  the  kingdom  ;  forbids  that  any  controversies  which  shall  arise  therein  re- 
garding  any  possessions  in  it  be  brought  to  trial  before  judges  without  the 
kingdom,  unless  there  is  an  appeal  to  the  Church  of  Rome ;  declaring  that  all 
writs  obtained  or  to  be  obtained  against  this  iudulgence  shall  cause  no  harm 
thereto  ;  and  confirms,  moreover,  all  the  liberties  and  immunities  granted  and 
hitherto  observed  by  the  Church  of  Rome  to  the  King,  the  kingdom,  and  the 
churches  therein,  saving,  however,  the  authority  of  the  Apostolic  See.  Given 
at  the  Lateran,  by  the  hand  of  Ranerius,  Vice-Chancellor  of  tlie  holy  Roman 
Church,  21st  November,  on  the  7th  Indiction,  in  the  3rd  year  of  the  Pope's 
consecration,  and  in  the  year  of  the  Incarnation  of  our  Lord,  1218. 

De  Electione  Gregorii  Episcopi  . 

CCCCXI.  Honorius  etc.  Episcopo   Sancti  Andree  .  Presentate  nobis  dilectorum  filiorum 
Capituli  Brechinensis  ecclesie  litere  continebant,  quod  eorum  ecclesia  pastoris 


388  LITERAE    PAPALES. 

solatio  destituta,  ipsi  prout  moris  est  conuenientes  iu  ununi,  Sancti  Spiritus 
gratia  inuocata,  dileetum  filium  Gregorium  eiusdem  ecclesie  archidiaconuui, 
iurium  scientia  et  moribus  adornatum,  sibi  elegerunt  canonice  et  concorditer  in 
pastorem  .  Un[de]  nobis  humiliter  supplicarunt,  ut  eldem  electo  faceremus 
munus  consecrationis  impendi  .  Nos,  igitur,  de  discretione  tua  gerentes  fiduciam 
pleniorem  fraternitati  tue  per  apostolica  scripta  mandamus  quatinus,  de  ipsius 
electiouis  modo,  eligentium  studiis,  et  electi  mcritip,  ueritate  plenius  inquisita, 
si  electionem  ipsam  inueueris  de  persona  ydonea,  que  tanto  congruat  oneri  et 
honori,  canonice  celebratam,  ipsam  auctoritate  nostra  confirmes,  et  adiunctis 
tibi  duobus  uel  tribus  conuicinis  episcopis,  eidem  Electo  munus  consecrationis 
impendas  .  Datum  Laterani,  xviii.  Kalendas  Januarii  Pontificalus  nostrl  anno 
tertio  .   [A.D.  1219.] 


CCCCXII.  Bull  of  Innocent  IV.,  sctting  furth  that  the  Canons  of  the  Church  of  Brechin 
havino-  met  together  on  the  vacancy  of  the  See  to  treat  concerning  the  ap- 
pointment  of  the  future   Bishop,  bad  unanimously   conferred   the   power   of 
providlng  a  pastor  to  that  church  on  three  of  their  number,  who  had  requestod 
that  Albinus,  prcceptor  of  that  Church,  a  man,  as  they  stated,  careful,  discreet, 
and  prudent  both  in  spiritual  and  temporal  matters,  and  born  of  unmarried 
parents,  should  be  appointed  its  pastor ;  that  the   Chapter  of  that  Church, 
tlierefore,   on  the  ground  that  not  only  did   his  merits  require  it,  but  also 
because  O.,  the  Bishop  of  Poi-to  and  legate  of  the  Apostolic  See  in   these 
parts,  had  thought  him  worthy  of  having  a  dispensation  to  receive  orders  and 
to  hold  ecclesiastical  benefices,  even  though  they  had  the  cure  of  souls  attached 
to  them,  had  humbly  petitioned  the  Pope  to  dispense  with  the  defect  of  the 
postulate's  birlli,  in  accordance  with  their  demand,  and  to  give  him  consecra- 
tion  ;  therefore,  although  the  said  master  Albinus  was  much  commended  for  his 
life,  manners,  and  learning,  and  so  was  wortby  of  obtaining  the  favour  of  this 
dispensation,  yet  because  it  was  written,  "Layhands  suddeuly  on  no  man," 
the  Pope  commands  the  bishops  of  St.  Andrevvs,  Glasgow,  and  Dunkeld,  after 
having  tirst  iustituted  a  careful  enquiry  as  to  whether  the  postulation  had  been 
canonically  made,  and  whether  the  postulate  had  the  character  and  learning 


LITERAE    PAPALES.  389 

fitting  him  for  tlie  government  of  the  chiirch  of  Brecbin,  to  give  the  dispensa^ 
tion  and  consecratioh  sought  according  to  the  canons,  and  to  make  his  subjects 
shew  him  due  reverence  and  obediencc,  taking  from  him,  in  the  name  of  the 
Pope  and  the  Church  of  Rome,  the  usual  oath  of  fidelity,  aecording  to  the  form 
sent  inclosed  in  tlie  bull,  and  sending  back  by  a  proper  messenger,  as  soon  as 
possible,  to  the  Pope  the  form  of  the  oath  sealed  with  the  seal  of  the  postulate  ; 
otherwise,  if  the  postulation  were  rejected,  to  cause  due  provision  be  made  for 
that  church  by  canonical  election.  Dated  at  Lyons,  19th  July,  in  the  fourth 
year  of  the  Pope's  consecration,     [A.D.  1247.] 


Concessio  Abbati  et  Conventui  de  Lyndore  . 

CCCCXIII.  Alexander  IV.  Abbati  et  Conventui  Monasterii  de  Lyndore  ordinis  Sancti 
Benedicti  Sancte  Andree  diocesis  .  Significastis  nobis  quod  vos  ecclesiam  de 
Dunde  Brethinensis  diocesis  in  usus  proprios  obtinetis,  in  qua  perpetua  vicaria 
auctox'itate  ordinaria  est  taxata  in  ea  perpetuo  vicario  ejusdem  ecclesie,  de  ipsius 
proventibus  assignata  portione  ex  qua  commode  sustentari  potest  et  tam  epis- 
copalia  quam  alia  ipsius  ecclesie  onera  supportare  .  Nos  vestris  supplicationi- 
bus  inciinati,  ne  diocesanus  vel  archidiaconus  loci,  occasione  predictorum 
onerum  que  dictus  vicarius  supportare  teaetur,  aliquid  de  portione  quam  vos  in 
eadem  ecclesia  obtinetis  exigere  vel  ipsam  portionem  sequestrare  presumant, 
auctoritate  presentium  distrietius  inhibemus  .  .  .  Datum  Laterani,  iiij  Idus 
Februarii,  anno  tertio  .  [A.D.  1257.] 


CCCCXIV.  Bull  of  Pope  John  XXII.  stating  that  the  care  of  all  the  churches,  and  es- 
pecially  of  those  immediately  subject  to  the  Church  of  Rome,  imposed  upon  him 
by  his  ofiice,  rendered  him  solicitous  to  make  provision  for  them  when  they 
were  vacant ;  that,  having  it  in  view  that  a  proper  and  useful  person  should 
preside  over  the  Church  of  Brechin  which  belonged  to  the  Church  of  Rome,  he 
had  reserved  to  the  disposal  of  himself  and  the  Apostolic  See  the  provision  of 
that  church,  on  its  becoming  vaeant,  by  the  death  of  John,  then  its  bishop,  or 


890  LITERAE    PAPALES. 

otherwise  ;  that,  accordingly,  on  the  death  of  Bishop  John,  he  had  turned  his 
eyes  upon  Adam,  now  Bishop  of  Brechin,  a  doctor  in  Canon  Law,  and  re- 
markable  for  his  many  virtues,  as  a  proper  person  for  him,  after  careful  con- 
sultation  with  his  brethren,  to  appoint  to  the  presidency  of  that  Church  and 
the  defence  and  augmentation  of  its  rights ;  and  therefore  appointing  him  bishop 
accordingly  ;  and,  since  he  had  caused  him  to  be  ordained  by  William,  Bishop 
of  Sabina,  granting  him  the  administration  of  the  spiritual  and  temporal  af- 
fairs  of  the  church,  and  commanding  him  to  proceed  to  the  church,  and  so  to 
bear  himself  in  its  administration,  instructing  the  Lord's  flock  in  the  doctrine 
of  word  and  work,  that  that  Church  might  rejoice  in  being  committed  to  the 
care  of  a  wise  governor  and  fruitful  administrator.  Dated  at  Avinion,  31st 
October,  in  the  thirteenth  year  of  the  Pope's  conseeration.    [A.D.  1328.] 

Slandates  to  the  chapter,  clergy,  and  people  of  the  city  and  diocese  of 
Brechin,  to  receive  the  Bishop  as  the  shepherd  of  their  souls,  and  to  render 
him  all  due  obedience  and  reverence,  else  his  sentence  against  rebels  would  be 
ratified  by  the  Pope.     Dated  as  above. 

Mandate  to  the  vassals  of  the  Bishopric  to  observe  due  fidelity  to  the  Bishop, 
and  to  render  to  him  the  usual  services  due  by  them,  uuder  the  like  penalty. 
Dated  as  above. 

Letter  to  Robert,  King  of  Scots,  requesting  and  e.xhorting  him,  since  it  is 
virtuous  to  favour  and  reverence  God's  servants,  to  afford  the  Bishop  the  aid 
of  his  kindly  good  will.     Dated  as  above. 


CCCCXV.  Bull  of  Pope  John  XXII.  conferring  on  William  de  Palmur,  canon  of  Brechin, 
on  account  of  the  many  virtues  for  which  he  was  commended  to  the  Pope,  a 
canonry  and  prebend  in  the  Church  of  Brechin,  with  all  the  rights  belonging 
to  them,  which  were  vacant  by  the  death  at  the  Apostolic  See  of  their  former 
possessor,  Thomas  de  Northam,  canon  of  tbat  church,  and,  before  that  v.acancy, 
had  been  reserved  by  the  Pope  to  his  own  collation ;  dispensing  with  all 
statutes  and  customs  of  the  church  of  Brechin  to  the  contrary,  and  giving  him 
a  preference  in  the  obtaining  of  this  eanonry  and  prebend  over  any  who  were 
received,  or  insisted  to  be  received,  as  canons  of  that  church,  through  Apostolic

or  any  other  authoi-ity,  notwithstanding  they  might  have  obtained  special 
letters  of  the  said  See  or  its  Legates  concerning  provision  being  made  to  them 
of  canonries  and  prebends  in  that  churcb,  or  general  letters  concernino'  ec- 
clesiastical  benefices  in  these  parts,  to  whatever  extent  proceediugs  micht 
have  been  carried  on  these  letters,  but  without  prejudice  to  such  pai-ties  ob- 
taining  other  canonries,  prebends,  and  benefices ;  declaring  that  the  Bishop 
and  Chapter  of  Brechin  should  not  be  bound  to  receive  any  person,  or  to  make 
provision  to  any  party  of  canonries  or  prebends  in  that  church,  or  of  other 
ecclesiastical  benefices  in  their  collation,  unless  by  Apostolic  letters  makino' 
full  and  express  mention  of  this  indulgence;  allowing  the  said  William  de 
Palmur,  if  absent,  to  take  the  usual  oath  for  observing  the  statutes  and  customs 
of  that  cburch  by  a  fit  procurator,  he  taking  the  oath  himself  when  lie  arrives

of  Dunkeld,  and  a  canonry  in  the  church  of  Moray  iu  the  expectation  of  a 
prebend.  Dated  at  Avinion,  28th  November,  in  the  fourteenth  year  of  tho 
Pope's  consecration.    [A.D.  1329.] 

Mandate  to  the  Bishop  and  Dean  of  Dunkeld,  and  Mr.  Williara  Comyn,

Pulmur  into  the  possession  of  the  above  canonry  and  prebend  and  all  its  rights 
and  revenues,  and  to  see  to  his  beiug  received  to  the  said  prebend  as  a  canon 
and  brother  in  the  foresaid  church  of  Brechin,  having  a  stall  in  the  choir  and  a 
place  in  the  cbapter  assigned  to  him.     Dated  as  above.

CCCCXVII.  Dispensation  by  Clement  VI.  conferring  on  David  de  Fowlarton,  clerk  of  tbe 
diocese  of  Brecbin,  the  power  to  accept  and  hold  an  ecclesiastical  beneficc

with  or  without  cure  in  the  presentation  of  the  Bishop,  Prior,  and  Chapter  of 
St.  Andrews,  the  income  of  which,  if  with  the  cure  of  souls,  shall  not  exceed 
twenty-five  mai-ks  sterling  yearly,  or,  if  without  the  cure  of  souls,  eighteen 
marks  sterling,  and  that  within  a  month  after  the  vacancy  of  any  such  henefice, 
if  he  think  proper  to  accept  of  it ;  reserving  the  same  from  the  collation  and 
presentation  of  the  saids  Bishop,  Prior,  and  Chapter,  until  the  said  David 
certify  them  of  his  unwillingness  to  accept  it.  Dated  at  Auinion,  19th  April, 
in  the  seventh  year  of  the  Pope'3  consecration.     [A.D.  1349.]
